column4: mkfs.ext4 /dev/sdb1: mke2fs 1.41.11 (14-Mar-2010) /dev/sdb1 is apparently in use by the system; will not make a filesystem here!
can someone tell me what I'm doing wrong?
sdb1 is mounted somewhere
what fs is sdb1 now?
i always use a gparted live cd normally to do this stuff. seems to cause less hassles.
http://pastie.org/2828680
so what are you formating it to?
I want /dev/sdb1 to be ext4
try mounting that fs now just to see if its allready formated
you tried just   rebootig, and trying the mkfs then?
make sure theres no fstab entries for the hd first
no I haven't rebooted after creating the partition, then mkfs .. didn't even think of it
will try that next
if you just made the partition. the kernal may be using the old info. theres some resync command that may get if figured out
I just created a primary partition, #1, on /dev/sdb so it is /dev/sdb1 ... just rebooted after making sure it isn't in fstab
/dev/sdb1 is apparently in use by the system; will not make a filesystem here!
weird. wonder how its using it with no fs.
there may be some force option to mkfs
man mkfs doesn't show any
try mkfs --help
this is a real machine, not some vps/vbox/other weirdness?
here is the output of trying to mount it... mount: unknown filesystem type 'LVM2_member'
